required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Etrasimod (APD334) in Patients With Primary Biliary Cholangitis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Pilot, Proof of Concept Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Efficacy of Oral Etrasimod (APD334) in Patients With Primary Biliary Cholangitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this open-label, pilot, proof of concept study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, and efficacy of oral etrasimod (APD334) in patients with primary biliary cholangitis (PBC).

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 24 in serum ALP concentration.
primary_outcome.description: Assess the change in ALP concentration following administration of APD334.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with adverse events and abnormal clinical laboratory tests (including hematology, serum chemistry, coagulation and urinalysis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 12 in serum ALP concentration.
secondary_outcome.description: Assess the change in ALP concentration following administration of APD334.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in complete blood counts
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in quality of life
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in fatigue
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in pruritus
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in Schirmer test outcome
secondary_outcome.description: Schirmer test in patients with abnormal results at screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in tear film break-up time
secondary_outcome.description: Tear film break-up time in patients with abnormal results at screening

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum HsCRP
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum ALT
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum AST
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum GGT
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum C4
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum immunoglobulin
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum GP73
Change from baseline to Week 12 and 24 in concentration of serum AMA

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females aged 18 to 80 years (inclusive) at the time of screening, with confirmed PBC diagnosis based upon at least 2 of 3 criteria:
- AMA titer >1:40 on immunofluorescence or M2 positive by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) or positive PBC-specific antinuclear antibodies (anti-GP210 and/or anti-SP100)
- ALP >1.5 x ULN for at least 6 months
- Liver biopsy findings consistent with PBC
- Use of UDCA for at least 6 months prior to screening (stable dose for at least 3 months immediately prior to screening)
- Patients must have ALP >1.5 x ULN but <10 x ULN, ALT and AST <5 x ULN, and total bilirubin <ULN, at all screening visits
- AST, ALT, ALP, and total bilirubin must have 2 values at least 4 weeks apart that are within 20% of each other
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic liver disease of a non-PBC etiology. However, PBC patients accompanied with primary Sj√∂gren's syndrome (pSS) are eligible to be enrolled.
- History or evidence of clinically significant hepatic decompensation
- Medical conditions that may cause non-hepatic increases in ALP (e.g., Paget's disease)
- Clinically significant infections within 6 weeks prior to treatment start, or infection with hepatitis C virus anytime in the past
- Immunosuppressive, immunomodulating, or investigational agents within 30 days prior to treatment start
- Treatment with OCA within 30 days prior to Day 1
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply

facility.name: Gastroenterology and Hepatology, UC Davis Medical Center
